Event registration, 7th of May, 13-17 at Kontrapunkt

* indicates required

Attraction design -
 next generation branding

Discover the future of attraction design – and explore our hands-on tech lab at a full-afternoon Kontrapunkt event. Presentations by Carlsberg brewhouse and Den Blå Planet.

May 7th - Sign up See full program

Come try all the technologies in our tech lab

  • Beacon technology

    Try the Beacon technology, allowing you to create customised museum itineraries and store experiences. ETT supplied Beacon technology to the Technology Museum in Milan, the first attraction to use Beacon on a large scale, incorporating it into the next-generation AV guide.

  • Virtual reality

    Explore simulations of real-world environments. The tech lab will include head-mounted Oculus Rift, the Epson Moverio motion tracker, Samsung Gear VR headset and Cardboard that transforms a cell phone into a VR headset.

  • Augmented reality

    Experience direct or indirect visions of a physical, real-world environment featuring elements augmented (or supplemented) by computer-generated sensory input, such as sound, video, graphics or GPS data.

  • Touchless application

    Discover touchless technologies, which will include leap motion, a 3D controller tracking hand and finger movements and the Kinect hands-free technology that can recognise specific gestures – technologies supplied by ETT to, e.g. the Turin Planetarium.

May 7th, 13:00-17:00
Kontrapunkt, Nikolaj Plads 2
Sign up

Agenda

A series of short and engaging presentations by Kontrapunkt and the people behind two of Copenhagen’s most visionary new attractions, the Carlsberg experience centre and the national aquarium, Den Blå Planet.

The afternoon also includes presentations by Italy’s pioneering tech company, ETT, creators of the soon-to-open Magna Carta exhibition in the UK and lead innovators on the Technology Museum in Milan.

13:00 Welcome by Kontrapunkt

Bold new attractions are being created by leading consumer brands with museums themselves fast becoming brands in their own right. How should this influence the way we design attractions, events and exhibitions? Learn about the 360° approach to branding using hands-on, minds-on technology.

13:15 – 15:15 Presentations

  • Brand experience

    How to integrate a strong and consistent brand experience comprising space, communication, identity and interactions.
    The presentation will be in Danish.

    Helene Øllgaard

    Senior Consultant, Identity

    Kontrapunkt

  • Carlsberg brewhouse

    Corporate storytelling and the upcoming Carlsberg Experience Centre (Copenhagen) designed by Ralph Appelbaum Associates (US) in association with attraction development company TVAC (UK).
    The presentation will be in Danish.

    Lone Johnsen

    Vice President of Events

    Carlsberg Group

  • Storytelling and exhibition design

    Storytelling is a driving factor behind exhibition design, it offers a narrative to interpret the past and shape the future. Valerio Rossi will initiate us in ETT’s approach to selecting the right mix of technology for the right story.
    The presentation will be in English

    Valerio Rossi

    ETT

  • Where to place the user in the design of your brand

    How to balance user needs and motivations with brand values in your digital solutions.
    The presentation will be in Danish.

    Peter Urban

    Digital designer

    Kontrapunkt

  • Exploring the potential of cross-sector technology

    Knowledge integration in museum design and the application of pioneering technology across business sectors – from marketing to attractions.
    The presentation will be in English

    Niccolò Caderni

    Chairman of the Board

    ETT

15.20 – 15.40 Wrap up and discussion

15:40 Intro to the tech lab

You are invited to explore the hands-on lab that includes first-time adaptations of technological solutions for the museum world, such as the upcoming Magna Carta exhibition (UK) and the Milan Technology Museum (IT).
The presentation will be in English

Giovanni Landi

ETT

16:00 Hands-on and mingling

May 7th - Sign up

17:00 Event concludes
